comments.commentBody: And the pensions that go or do not go with those new jobs are not addressed as usual. I guess we can assume they are  getting a $12,000 yearly pension bonus like New York City gives just to comply with the equal protection clause in addition to a fabulous normal pension to keep the dollar as a medium of exchange from being in violation of interstate restraint of trade laws. Is this a great country  OR WHAT?
Couldn't a line be drawn between Julius Peppers and LT, as well?

I realized the fact that only low paying jobs will exist in America after my software engineering job was outsourced to India just after 9/11 when 5,000 of my co-workers and I were laid off in one day. Since then I haven't been able to find a job anywhere.

The effect on the home heating oil price is disturbing. Besides that and food however, I don't participate in the U.S economy. Two years ago, I took flights, ate in restaurants, drove my car etc. Now, I hunker down and wait for World War 3 to end the Depression. I know, some people believe the governments unemployment numbers- they are the offspring of the people that believed the government Vietnam death numbers circa 1968.

No surprise here. Hey, lets bust the unions and teach those uppity school teachers and garbage men a thing or two.

Is the US doing anything?  Iran is sending warships through the Suez- did we have Destroyers shadowing them? NO.   Americans killed off Somalia.  Are we bombing them? No. I really don't get why we arent using our might to make some sort of difference.  Obama, even though I voted for him, is like a deer in the headlights now.

I guess the fact that the corporate profits in relation to GDP are at the record high has something to do with the article's statistics. Outsourcing "helps", as well. Most amazing that the few benefiting from these trends have guts to claim Obama is a redistributionist.
The same exact jobs are paying less.
This is why outsourcing should be considered treason.

I highly recommend Charles' opinion--US and NATO should take actions immediately to save the lives of people in need. There is no need to organize meetings again and again--UN just has one meeting already but did nothing meaningful except wasting valuable time. Why did obama send clinton to europe to have a meeting again? US president is in leading the military and can influence the NATO by himself. He should call other countries' leader and coordinate a military action, rather than to get his administrations' suggestion on options. If he can not make a good decision, why should he be the President?

For more news and opinions regard Arab world changes, I recommend a news website: http://consumerask.com/politics.html

The 173RCT is in Italy. There must be a Marine Expeditionary Unit in the Med with the 6th Fleet. Land the Marines in Tripoli (They've been there before, right!) Seize an airfield. Fly the 173 in. Get Ghaddaffi and his sons. Turn them over to the Libyans so that they can deal with them. Secure the oil fields. Call the Italians in to guard the oil until the Libyans take over. Pull the Marines and the 173 out. We shouldn't be there more than 2 weeks.

Why did we call them contractors in Iraq, when we used them, and then when Lybya uses them we call them mercenaries?
Why did we call them contractors in Iraq, when we used them, and then when Lybya uses them we call them mercenaries?
$19.05 and hour is a high wage. Hmmmm.  Let's pay the bankers that rate.
the job market's terrible.  I got laid off from a IT support job 8 months ago and can't find anything except low rent mall jobs at minimum wage.  the recession is worse than ever.

This is such a reinforcement of attitudes that seems to be tainting the views of folks who have no clue about the value of the HBCU education and experience. The "rosed colored glasses" people is what I call them. They are the same people who have never had to face the racial challenges, and would argue without reservation that racism no longer exist in America...(chuckle). My husband and I both attended HBCUs, and had opportunities to attend TWI institutions but preferred the HBCU. Things have worked out pretty well in our careers. Completing school at an HBCU did not make us narrow-minded about working in corporate America. We both work in environments that are comprised primarily of more Whites than African-Americans, and we've met the challenges when they arise and moved through them confidently. That's what a strong developmental foundation during college has provided for us in the HBCU experience. Interestingly enough, one of our children attempted college at a TWI, and failed misrably after attending mostly white middle and high schools. Our younger children however attend(s) (ed) the best HBCU's, love(s)(d) the college experience, felt a real sense of community and belonging immediately, and are on point with non-HBCU students in terms of academically competitiveness and wage ratio. Statistics are strongly subjective, it's all in how we slice the numbers to tell the story. Like in every facet of our fallen economy, there are some HBCU's that are not doing well, but this is not a call to question the affectiveness of all HBCU's. When picking an institution of higher learning, it pays to know where your student will perform best and achieve the results they aspire to, whether at a TWI or an HBCU. So what then is the real point of this article?

Are u kidding me? Competing against other states is not the same as competing against Chinese workers. For one they make like 1/5 of what US workers make. How do you propose someone adjust to that? Move into an abandon tub in the woods?

Score another victory for big business and corporations! Obama is turning out to be a boon for conservatives and leaves supporters like me scratching his head, doubting that system works for more anymore.

Game over. It's rigged in favor of a few wealthy industries and big time political cash contributors. I knew we were in trouble when he appointed Daley as his Chief of Staff - a former Wall Street goon who was at JP Morgan when the financial meltdown was going on. Talk about the foxes guarding the henhouse!

I feel so overwhelmed and underminded. This political system is a travesty. I still pay taxes and I'm not getting a bang for my paltry buck.

Everything is falling apart. Add the loosening of environmental restrictions to the list of tax cuts for wealthy people, addresses to the Chamber of Commerce, turning off the heat for the poor and elderly, reduced funding for schools, not standing up for the rights of workers, a guy who talks more about unrest in the Middle East than he does about unrest in his own country.

I thought I voted for a Democrat in the last election. I thought wrong!

Since unemployment figures continually perpetuate the mythe that the solution is for all Americansn to have a four year degree and current statistics demonstrates that those with four year degrees have a lower level of unemployment an inference can be drawn that all of those low qualifying, low paying service jobs are going primarily to college grads.
Do you really read 100's of dollars of debt to to change bedsheets?
This is a Grim Great Depression that we live in now that is doubling in severity each year.
Gotta love us boomers .We live off the infrastructure our parents built and finance our arrogance on the backs of our kids .Then we philosophize on the suffering of the affluent . Wow we are special.
